Reviews.Title: “Excellent rates and location”
Reviews.Author: dehnehsu
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the recent room renovations. Some of the best rates for the Hollywood area. The entire property is very well maintained. Nice clean rooms with new Flatscreen HD TV's however the cable feed was the standard 4x3 definition. One wing was being renovated but the free Parking spaces did fill up with only a few open slots late. I wish they would assign parking spaces so you could rest easy knowing there will a slot open late at night if you drive around. We chose this Hotel because of price, free parking, and it's close to the Metro Subway station. It's only a half block or a few minutes walk away to the corner. (Hollywood and Western) The Metro takes you directly to the Hollywood Blvd, Highland area, and Universal Studios where you can take a free Tram to Universal saving on Parking fees. Also on the corner are a Ross, Ralphs grocery store, A Walgreens and some fast food options. At first glance it might look like a sketchy neighborhood. but it really isn't bad at all. It's pretty safe day or night walking to the corner from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: mulberry85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my first night in L.A. as a base while I got my bearings. Management/front desk incredibly unhelpful, just flung the keys at us upon arrival. Room wasn't even ready (well past standard check in time) so we had to hang around for half an hour with no apologies or sympathy. Scary neighbourhood, did not feel comfortable there. Beds were average, as were the room but I guess I can't complain too much for the price we paid. Breakfast options however were good, loved that you could just grab a banana and a donut etc and all free. No safes in room which was annoying. I'd stay there again only if I was going to be looking at Hollywood attractions that day as I was but otherwise - steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “would NEVER stay again!”
Reviews.Author: d w
Reviews.Content: our hotel room was disgusting... the "perfume" smell was overwhelming when we arrived, we had to keep the door open for an hour to clear it out... we realized the next morning why it was so powerful, to cover the MOLD! It was in the bathroom (you could see where they tried to paint over it!) and it was around the top edges of the main sleeping area, by the time morning came the smell in the room was horrid, mold/chemicals it was disgusting! the noise from the street and the shaking of the room all night from trucks driving by was a nuisance as well. Oh and the continental breakfast was only cereal and donuts... no toast, protein, water etc... terrible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service/ noise disturbances all night”
Reviews.Author: Djnsw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were kept up all night by an alarm and hotel staff did not care that we were being disturbed. I would never ever stay here again where you can not sleep because of the noise!! If we didn't have two young kids with us I would have demanded my money back and left at 2:30 in the middle of the night! The uncaring staff was the worst part! Plus it's quite dumpy... Awful choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / value”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hollywood City Inn for 2 weeks. The room were spacious and clean. Wi-fi, TV, Fridge, and a comfortable bed. Friendly and helpful staff. The location is fantastic, quite convenient, near to the subway/bus stop, supermarkets, grocery stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “location-location-excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Krystav
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hollywood City Inn for four nights. Rooms are spacious and while decor is dated, beds are comfortable and room+bathroom was clean. Room came equipped with television, complimentary wifi and a mini fridge. Motel pool, while small, was clean and enjoyable. Complimentary breakfast was dougnuts/fruit/beverages. Location is very convenient. Close to subway/bus stops and freeway on/off ramp. Several cheap supermarkets/grocery stores nearby for supplies. Starbucks about a block away and several fast food and mexican restaurants within a block/two block radius too. Area at first looked a bit shady to us, but we found it to be no problem at all, even when walking late at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: JenGraham
Reviews.Content: The motel is basic but exactly what we were looking for. The rooms were big and clean enough with a fridge and a TV, we didn't intend to spend much time in the room anyway. We drove from Las Vegas and it's extremely easy to find, just off the freeway, with ample parking spaces. The reception staff were friendly and assisted us with any requests. There isn't much round about the motel but it is a 2 minute walk up to Hollywood Blvd and then maybe another 10 minutes until you hit the stars and the beginning of the walk of fame so the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay when you are out and about”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Darwin_NT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. We checked in around 7.30pm on a Saturday night. I was worried about walking around at night, the receptionist assured us it was ok and it was. I was so excited to find the cheap supermarkets one street away and we stocked up on groceries! The location of this hotel was pretty great. In hindsight I would have stayed a bit closer to Hollywood Strip as I prefer to walk, but the Metro was great. Once we discovered the busses too, they were so easy to get around on. The hotel itself was clean but basic. The room was quite large. Two double beds, a bathroom with bath, and a little lounge area. Though there was no iron. (Or fridge! but as I continued my travels across the US none of the hotels had a fridge - must be an Australian thing!) Do not book a tour wioth the reception staff as they take a HUUUUGE cut! Walk down to the strip and buy tours off the street for half the price. in all, if you do not plan to spend much time at the hotel, this will be fine. The area is safe and convenient, there is Starbucks, Ross, McDonalds, Dennys, and louds of otherrestuarants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: racheldink
Reviews.Content: I'm not very picky when it comes to hotels and I don't really need much, just a clean room and non-shady neighbors. I guess I got that with this hotel. But there were a lot of little annoying things that bothered me. For the price I paid it's no big deal though. So here's what they could improve on: 1. fruit fly on my toothbrush 2. pervasive smell of soap in the room 3. sawing noise very early in the morning (they were doing some renovations.) 4. mattress with huge brown stain propped against the balcony overlooking pool for a couple days (with a bunch of other furniture moved out of the rooms they were renovating) 5. no tables to sit down at breakfast, except for 1 outside by the pool. Other than that, OK!

Reviews.Title: “good for price”
Reviews.Author: malibu-jenni
Reviews.Content: Overall was good to stay here when in Hollywood for this price. the best thing was the free morning doughnuts WOW so tasty! also free newspaper, and is 2 min walk from the underground. We walked into Hollywood from here, but quite a long walk. The neighbourhood is a little rough looking, and I did not like the fact that there was no safety deposit box available, so we kept our valuables locked in our cases. Also I do not usually react to products, but the shampoo supplied actually burnt into my scalp! So definitely avoid using it! If I ever come back to Los Angeles, I would try to stay in the Santa Monica area, and not the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: Jen520
Reviews.Content: We spent three nits at this motel The room is good for it price. Its clean and the bathroom is tidy too. However the airconditon have a little smell as it has been used for quite a while. But u could open the window for a refresh The service is good enough for a motel . 24 hr front desk so u could check out in early morning to catch flight. Staff are friendly and helpful. Motel is located in Tai Town. If u are girls try to get back early. To say that am not feeling safe in anywhere of L.A. There seems someone knicking the door at 4am. We think it might be a mistake of sb. finding their room. Breakfast are self-serving coffee and donuts/ crossiant. As well as cereals. Overall. If u re on a budget u can totally go there

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: cmo_matsuk
Reviews.Content: Old-fashioned rooms and not the nicest service. The laundry - OMG, avoid at all costs! But the location is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Dirty Linens. Rude front desk service.”
Reviews.Author: SJunie
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place that is easily accessible to public transit or cheap, good eats, read no further. This is the place for you. But if customer service and cleanliness are important, then DO NOT stay here. We stayed one night here before moving on to a much better place at The Orlando in West Hollywwod. Best decision we ever made. Sometimes, you get what you pay for. Here are the problems that we had with this place: 1. We found strands of long hair and stains on the bed sheet when we pulled back the linens to check for bedbugs. There were also strands of hair within some of the folded towels. 2. They use copious amounts of air freshener to give the illusion that everything is clean and fresh. If you are sensitive to scents, this will be a problem. 3. When I asked for a hairdryer for the room (which is supposed to be part of the amenities), the individual at the front desk insisted that there was one even though I kept telling him that there wasn't one. Finally, he said that he would get me one as I wanted to wash my hair and go to bed as it was beyond midnight. He didn't show up for the longest time, and when I called to inquire, he was rude and said that he had already told me that he would get me one. They must be rolling in business if they think that it's ok to talk to a customer that way and think that it is acceptable. Finally, a hairdryer arrives, but then he insisted on coming into my room to "check" that it worked. Creepy. 4. They demand that you give them your driver's license at check in and they make a photocopy of it. I wasn't thrilled about this as I had already had my identity stolen once and credit cards and cell phones accounts opened in my name. It was a pain to sort it all out. At check out, I asked for the photocopy back and was told that I wasn't allowed to have it. I then asked that I be allowed to at least black out my DOB and was told that I wasn't allowed, either. "Tito"-if that is his real name, was absolutely rude and a complete liar. I explained my concerns to him, and not only was he totally dismissive, he lied and claimed that all hotels photocopy their customer's licenses and keep them all on file. He couldn't tell me what their rationale is for keeping these photocopies, and he couldn't tell me how they dispose of them. He kept insisting that no one else has problems with this, and to prove the point, he showed me other people's photocopied licenses. Great job keeping people's information secure, Tito! The bottom line is if professionalism, cleanliness, and honest service matters to you, again, DO NOT stay at the Holiday City Inn. You really have to wonder about a place that makes you give up and keeps your private information for a lousy stay.

Reviews.Title: “well good”
Reviews.Author: Joanne N
Reviews.Content: Hollywood city inn is a good place to stay, it is handy for the hollywood walk of fame, griffith park and universal studio ect the staff there were very helpfull and friendly and and the maids were very good at keeping the rooms clean and tidy over all i am very pleased with my stay

Reviews.Title: “Price quality can't be better”
Reviews.Author: bosbes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in room 210 on the top floor facing the pool. Great hotel, perfect location in Hollywood and good quality for the price of $75,- a night. Tahir the guy at the front desk was very nice. The room smelled fresh and was spacious. We had noisy Japanse neighbours the first night but slept very well anyway. There also is another building with an interior corridor, I am not sure if there are rooms too. The shower was a bit old but functioning very well and there is a small breakfast in the morning with coffee, juice, donuts and croissants. Wifi worked fine, we didn't use the pool but it looked nice and clean. I really liked staying here and will definitely stay again to save some money!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN HOLLYWOOD”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: This is a best hotel in hollywood area, i loved this place. nice roses and beautiful pool. plenty of parking. Most of rooms are non smoking cause i saw lots of guest smoking outside their rooms and i found ash trays out there. Staff is very friendly, specially Tahir is very helpful and guide us to move around. I will stay again. Nice and clean rooms. You may find some bad reviews but they are individuals. Thumbs up for this place. enough things for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “No Non-Smoking Guarantee”
Reviews.Author: Gadfly1
Reviews.Content: This property seemed well reviewed, but when I called to make a reservation they refused to guarantee a non-smoking room. As I was planning to stay five days, this was very important to me. You should be warned that they don't guarantee non-smoking, so presumably people are smoking in all the rooms from time to time. As a result, I did not book a room with this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn;t seem safe”
Reviews.Author: GigTraveler
Reviews.Content: We tried to save a buck but it wasn't worth it. The air conditioner was broken and we couldnt open the window due to the area. Seemed clean enough and was quiet...but will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, dated, nice doughnuts!”
Reviews.Author: Aseild
Reviews.Content: Arrived in LA for a few nights, excellent location just two stops on underground to central Hollywood. Wifi free and didn't work at corner of room, but fine everywhere else. Room very dated, a little dark, clean, soft bed, fridge, microwave, no safe, toiletries. Breakfast lovely fresh doughnuts and croissants. Overall a good place to stay, nothing flash.

Reviews.Title: “Next time we choose another hotel: Bad smell, cockroach and bad english”
Reviews.Author: Ballyx
Reviews.Content: In this hotel, we stayed three nights. I'm don't complain much, but this hotel is not recommandable! The receptionist doesn't understand a word english, the room smelled like urine and everyday there was a little cockroach in our bathroom (after i killed the previous one). The rooms where not dirty, had a TV and the location was good. Breakfast was not much, cereals and donuts, and you had to eat outside by the pool. If your lucky you can sit. And there is no elevator, so if you have a room on the 2nd floor (1st for the dutch, we dont count the groundfloor) you have to use the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you are on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine--xxxx
Reviews.Content: When looking for a fairly cheap yet decent hotel in LA we had massive difficulties, there just didn't seem to be much apart from very expensive hotels. Im so glad we eventually found the Hollywood City Inn. Upon arrival at the hotel we were a little anxious, as its a little ugly looking from outside. However, when we checked in at reception the staff were very helpful and our room was very nice. It was exactly what we needed, clean and tidy, no frills but thats not what we were looking for anyway. Theres free internet access in the reception area, leaflets on all the tourist events and breakfast in the morning. The hotel is also in a good location, a 2 min walk from a metro, which we used lots- its a great way to get around! Overall I would throughly reccommend this hotel if your not bothered about frills!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget stay”
Reviews.Author: dilbert1970
Reviews.Content: The Inn is a good choice fora budget stay in LA. The room was comfortable but showed more than a sign of age, which is the only reason I don't feel like giving it 4/5. Quite limited choice of food for breakfast, but it's there, included in the room rate. Good location for driving to the Studios, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and downtown. Free parking is a treat in LA. Overall a good choice for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Christinet09
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel. Nice, well maintained pool area with beautiful roses all around. The room was absolutely fine. No complaints at all. We really enjoyed our donut breakfast sat by the pool in the wonderful LA sunshine! How I wish all breakfast times could be like that - although not so good for the waistline. Never mind! Handy to have parking at the hotel as well, and it was easy to find also. The staff were quite helpful. There isn't a lot of bars, restaurants, etc, that we could find in the immediate vicinity but it is great as a base. Loved LA as well, have to say!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Oasis in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gkeim
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here with our 2 children in a downstairs 2x queen room. The room was pleasant and clean and a good size, beds comfortable. The pool area was very nice to relax in after a busy day. There was breakfast of pastries, mainly donuts, one cereal, milk, juice, tea and coffee available in the small lobby but you need to eat it by the pool or in your room. The donuts were (too) delicious but my stomach had had enough by the third morning! There was a station across the road but we didn't use it as we had a car. There were also a couple of nice Thai restaurants within walking distance, a McDonalds and a few supermarkets which were handy. The immediate area was a little seedy, especially at night although it didn't seem particularly unsafe - short drive to Walk of Fame and close to Universal Studios. Overall it was nice to return here after a long day of tourist activities and a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: DimitriB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good choice if you want to stay in LA for a budget price. It's a bit old fashioned but clean. Breakfast is nothing more than doughnuts and cakes but they are really fresh and tastefull. A Subway restaurant is around the corner if you want to have a better breakfast. A ten minutes drive brings you to downtown LA. The highway entrance is near the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price! I have been here for 3 times! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: soochie
Reviews.Content: Firstly, talk about nearby amenities around the hotel walking distance to Metro (Hollywood/Western Station) walking distance to CVS pharma, Ralphs, and Starbucks! FREE carpark!! Secondly, talk about the hotel itself Ultra accommodating and friendly staff! ask them questions, they will glady help. Quiet area/street, Clean room, no bugs no smell! Breakfast is great, donuts and milk!! Orange Juice available depend on availability. Has got a pool. So do take a dip if necessary! Free internet! Remember to get the ID and password before proceed to your room

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, average hotel, 2mins walk to metro, however pretty dodgy part of town”
Reviews.Author: LeonieF88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we wanted somewhere economical within walking distance to a metro station and this met our criteria at around US$80 per night inc tax and 2mins walk to Hollywood/Western metro station on the red line (which incidentally is just 3 stops from Universal Studios). The staff were probably the nicest, friendliest, most genuine and helpful of all the hotel staff we met during our US holiday. The room was big and had a fridge and microwave. The hotel is fairly old and run down but the room was clean enough. Free breakfast (of donuts and croissants) and free wi-fi. However it is not a particular good area and we did feel a quite unsafe walking around at night. 5-10mins walk from restaurants and shops. On the edge of Thai Town. I recommend heading down Western and turning right when you reach Walgreens. There you'll find Subway, Burger King and other fast food shops as well as a FANTASTIC shop that sells frozen yoghurt - which is more like icecream than yoghurt. It was the best food experience I had during my time in the US. Don't miss it! This hotel is good if you want to be near the red line but try to avoid walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, i enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: rehanasif
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel... Friendly and hospitable front desk staff... Nice clean and big rooms... Beds were comfortable... The location was perfect for hollywood street and universal studios... I had a gr8 time and i will b coming bk soon...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JessHowell
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. When we first arrived we thought that we had made a big mistake and we were really unhappy to be staying here BUT it didn't take us long to realise that it was great value for money. It is about a 20 to 30 minute walk to the centre of Hollywood but there is a train station only about a 2 to 3 minute walk from the motel. Take the line to North Hollywood, 2 stops and get off at Hollywood/Highland, It's only $1.50 for 1 way travel or $6 for all day and it takes less than 5 minutes. It's only about a $10 taxi ride which we usually paid for once it was dark. The street the motel is on seems a little dodgy but we didn't have any dramas at all. It's far enough away from the hussle and bustle so we were able to sleep peacefully but with the train it was so easy and quick to get right into the centre. The washing machine and dryer were a great help, at only $1 (must have 4 x $.0.25). The continental breakfast was not too flash but it was better than nothing. The rooms were quite dated but clean and were not too small. I found the staff there was not very helpful and always seemed to be annoyed. Everytime I went into reception (every morning for breakfast), the lady was on the phone and it sounded like a personal call. Even when I wanted to ask a question, I had to wait and then she just put the phone on her shouler, very quickly and basically answered my question, then continued on with her call.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, basic, good location for driving to Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: daisykitten
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, the room was basic, with a t.v. fridge and large double bed. There were blinds on the windows which didn't block out all the light. There was a small pool which looked nice, but we didn't use. Parking was free and we always found a place to park. You can't walk to anywhere from this hotel, but the drive to hollywood and other areas isn't to bad. I would recommend this hotel if you plan on just using it as a place to crash and arn't staying to long.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: missclairee
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here. I am not one to write reviews, however I feel I should write on this hotel. My partner and I stayed here one out of 5 nights at the beginning of this month. We arrived late at night tired and jet lagged. On arrival, One block from the hotel was a group of drunk men standing on the corner being abusive. Further up were mass of police and a group of men pinned against a wall. On arrival to the hotel we were given our keys and went to our room. The hotel was awful. Damp sheets and bed, fixtures hanging off, non working shower, lights not working bad smells. We did not feel comfortable and slept terrible against the noise and what appeared to be gun shots. I know that it sounds far fetched, but it truly was awful! We love our basic low cost hotels and usually stay in them for the experience... Afterall it is just somewhere to sleep and we booked here based on the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “nice welcome to hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gazfarr
Reviews.Content: stayed here for first night of our road trip from LA to SF, and provided a nice welcome. Comfortable large clean room, ample off road parking, and the surrounding whilst not "a-list" felt safe enough to walk in. Just a short drive from the sights and the strip and good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay with excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: asim11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood City Inn for 4 nights. The room was spacious and comfortable - our room had a microwave and fridge. The hotel had free parking which was great and very convenient it also included HBO. The donuts included in the continental breakfast were delicious! There were also a few excellent thai restaurants in walking distance as well as a starbucks and cvs. The hotel is in walking distance to Griffith Park as well as Hollywood Blvd. One night there were people being loud outside late at night but it was brief. We didn't hear any traffic noise at all. Also the bathroom door didn't close very easily but it wasn't a big deal. I would stay here again if returning to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice, need some maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: Hipolito_Bouchard
Reviews.Content: When I saw the ratings of this hotel I was surprised, an 88% acceptance level was very interesting. I suppose that the reviews were just after the hotel was renovated. Now it is not in good shape, really. The breakfast is not a continental breakfast, its just a take-out buffet, with two coffee makers, some donuts and a little fridge with one gallon bottle of juice and another of milk. There is no room to stand there, neither any chairs, just one that is fitted to be used with the computer. Wi fi works fine, slow but steady. The walls are thin, so you can hear other guests. The area is almost ok, but I advise you that by night it is not the best place to hang around. Too many homeless and addicts. There was a quite angry russian couple that realized there that the hotel had no cribs at all. So if you are going with your baby, take that in account. The bathroom had a dirty door that was never cleaned, there is a chest of drawers with all of them broken. The soap and paper is really cheap, and almost useless. When we arrived at the hotel it was 1.49, just 10 minutes away from our check in time. We waited for our room for a while, and at 2.20 I went to see what was delaying us. The housekeepers where having lunch at one of the tables near the pool. The rooms where open, with carts in the outside, but we had to wait until 2.45 to get the room. I think they could improve a little about the lunch time issue. Pros: Somewhat cheap. Close to Ralphs, Walgreens, gas. Free parking. Wi-fi. Cons: It is 5 minutes to Kodak Theatre, but the zone looks unsafe. Breakfast is poor. The furniture is in the throes of death. P.S. If you can skip this one and find a better hotel, go ahead, use this one just for an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to shops and eateries.”
Reviews.Author: shirleyjoy
Reviews.Content: Simple motel with reasonable fittings. A bit old fashioned but clean. The worst toilet paper of any motel I stayed at in the USA. Very thin and hard. Maybe the owners should use it for a week. Do nuts and croissants for breakfast. Internet service available at the front office. Staff very friendly. Room was always clean. It was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good value!”
Reviews.Author: 2travellers63
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in this hotel. For us, this hotel was quite good. We both are female, but we didn't have any problem walking around there at night ( 7 pm to 10 pm). The hotel is very close to the hollywood Western Metro Station. We didn't have a car, so we took the metro to go everywhere in LA ...very convenient... Breakfast was ok...Doughnuts were not too bad. Beside coffee, there was some juice and milk in the fridge. The hotel is so close to THai Town, so we had delicious dinner in Thaitown every night. what more... there is CVS, Starbuck right around the corner...just about 1 min from the hotel...The guys who worked there were nice. The room was clean. The beds were not too bad... However, the last night before we left, there were two ladies living next door making a very loud noise all night...it was very annoying...well I didn't blame the hotel. it was something like manner that everybody should realize. ... if I go to LA again, I will not reluctant to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: liliny
Reviews.Content: Two of us spent 2 nights there. I am not sure if this hotel offers better deal than other budget hotels in LA but we stayed in CA in other budget places and Hollywood City Inn provided the least pleasant experience. It was just OK. The staff was nice. The hotel, or our room at least, was really worn down. The sheets had holes, one of the comforters had an iron-size hole. The room smelled a little bit - I guessed it was because we asked for a non-smoking and they gave us a smoking room sprayed with some kind of air-freshener. There was a microwave and refrigerator, no hair-dryer or coffee maker. At the front desk they had doughnuts, coffee, milk, corn cereal every morning. Not a real breakfast or place to sit down and eat. So basically we had to buy our breakfast somewhere else. I expected no breakfast but given the prices in LA you might want to consider another hotel with continental breakfast. If I ever go back to LA I don't think I will be staying there again. I chose 'yes, I would recommend this hotel to a friend' because it was safe and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: SATOKUB
Reviews.Content: Though we had a car, but we took Metro to visit Hollywood downtown (Chinese theater/Kodak Center). One way is only $1.50 and it took less than 10 minutes. I believe same price to go to Los Angeles downtown as well. Metro station/CVS/Starbucks/supermarket are all in 2, 3 minutes walk. Room/bath/shower are clean and there are mini-fridge and microwave. Free Wi-Fi was working great. One drawback was that we could hear people walking upstairs, so next time we'll ask for a room on 2nd floor. Lost of place to eat in neibourhood, Thai town is nearby, within 3 blocks you can find several Thai restaurants where you can have good food with good price. We felt pretty safe walking around the area even after dark (winter short day) like 8 o'clock. Breakfast were OJ, Coffee, Cornflakes, pastries, which was pretty good. Overall this place has good value. We'll be back next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent transport links. Don't need a car!”
Reviews.Author: RalphLee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, booked through a third party site and got a very good rate. I was pleased overall with the hotel. I had a ground floor, king size room, which was large, clean and comfortable. The fridge and microwave are a bonus if you are on a budget as there are restaurants and supermarkets, drugstores, all in close proximity to the hotel. I felt that the area was reasonably safe, as most of the people you encounter are workers in the area or other tourists/travelllers. Yes there are homeless people, just like any other major city in the world. The public transport is very accessible and cheap! I didn't have a car, but was able to easily reach all of the tourist areas, downtown and airport. To get from the airport to the hotel will cost $8.50 and could take up to an hour and a half in peak time, but its much cheaper than a taxi or shuttle! From the airport take the Flyaway bus (under the green sign) to Union station. Make sure the bus is going to Union because there are a few different buses that leave from here. From Union station take the redline metro to Hollywood/Western station - North Hollywood - and from there it is a very short walk to the hotel. To go to Hollywood major tourist areas, take the red metro train 2 stops to Hollywood/Highland station, less than 10 minutes, which will take you directly to the Highland Shopping complex, Chinese theatre, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emcgui15
Reviews.Content: I came here with my friend on holiday and we believe we really pulled it off with this hotel. It was great value for money as the rooms were very clean and roomy. The Breakfast was cereal or donuts. I really wished i went for the more slimming cereal option however the donuts were for too tasty 'n' scrumptious to ignore. The location was actally better than i first thought, the metro was a 2minute walk down the road, across the road from a CVS (who doesn't love a CVS) and a starbucks. In the other direction there were multiple take away food places and a 'Food 4 less' supermarket. My friend and I raided this shop for juice, crisps and dip as we had a fridge in the room. But Paco who runs the hotel was one of the nicest people I met in LA. He was such a nice guy, very helpful. The hotel was good by its self, but Paco makes this hotel exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!!!”
Reviews.Author: dessislava
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights at this hotel. Room was cleaned every day, no problems. We had hot water at all times and fresh towels. The man in the reception was friendly and there was free internet to use. He was also able to give instructions if we needed to go somewhere. Lovely pool area but unfortunately it was not warm enough to use it. Area around hotel was rough (as it is most of L.A) and smelt very bad in places. Breakfast was orange juice, coffee,tea , croissants and a selection of doughnuts. Nearest metro station was only 1 minute walk as well as the bus stop. Bed was very large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: cleoder
Reviews.Content: This motel is located just off Hollywood Blvd. & about 4 blocks from Griffith Park. The rooms are newly decorated as is the exterior. Our room was much larger than most motel rooms with a fridge & microwave. The court yard pool is clean with seating to enjoy the continental breakfast provided daily. Parking is free but a little tight. Restaurants are close by and tours of the area leaving from the Chinese Theatre are about 2 miles away. WiFi connection was free with good reception. The only draw back is the staff. They tried to charge us for room again and sent us to a room that was already occupied. Not real polite either

Reviews.Title: “a great place for every one and every thing”
Reviews.Author: MiaoE
Reviews.Content: i had a wonderful time in the hotel. the workers were nice and helpful, the room was cozy, the outsides with the pool was lovely. you can get free access to internet, it is close to public transportation. what else can you ask for? one point to every person not from LA, there is an information center, right on Hollywood Blvd. next to the metro "Hollywood / Highland Station" and the "Grauman's Chinese Theatre", what ever you didn't find in the hotel or on the net, specifically about public transportation, they are happy to help! (another easy way to get there is with line number 2 next to the hotel on sunset Blvd.) enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring LA”
Reviews.Author: amz1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent a week here in September. The hotel is located in West Hollywood / Thai town and yes there are a few dodgy characters around but its like that all over LA! It is located right near the Hollywood Western Metro and is only a couple of stops from Hollywood Boulevard. The rooms are clean, the showers are good and the bed are big and comfortable but there was no wardrobe in our room. The hotel staff are okay but I get the feeling they wouldn't go out of their way for you. The continental breakfast consists of Doughnuts, Croissants and Frosties. This got a bit tedious after a week but the doughnuts were good! For LA the hotel is reasonably priced and is in a good location for sightseeing although LA can be tiring using public transport. But then again I wouldn't have wanted to pay the parking prices in LA!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near freeways, great service and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Guidoncio
Reviews.Content: Has great location, close to Freeways, highways and Hollywood Blvd. The correct classification should be 2.5 stars. There is room for improvement but the price is right, and also has free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Nabrab
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room with 2 double beds. The room and the bathroom were very clean and quiet The croissants served at the breakfast had the taste of French croissants ! Location is good, near metro station. We paid $ 91,- a night all taxes included. It is a decent price for a decent hotel in LA. Do not expect to be in The Regent Beverly Wilshire but it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: somecoolchick
Reviews.Content: It's not much dearer to stay somewhere else these days, especially if you book your hotel and flight seperate. Try to stay somewhere safer, somewhere in Beverly Hills or near Universal Studios or Hollywood Boulevard (by the popular walk of fame part). I stayed here a while ago now but I assume the area hasn't changed much. The hotel itself was okay, a little stinky and the shower was broken and it was full so we couldn't change rooms so we had to wash our hair all week using a bucket hahaha. It is cleaned everyday though by a nice cleaning lady. There was flies everywhere but to be honest it was roasting so I bet you get bugs everywhere in the summer. The pool looked OK but I didn't go in. The breakfast was just donuts and they were stale. We didn't have cars and the people just looked at us like we were speaking another language when we said this, they wouldn't even try to help us get around LA or give us maps or anything! haha they were nice but not very helpful for tourists. They did have a PC with internet and a printer for a charge though for maps and things. Wasn't the hotel that bothered me so much though, it was the area at night. I was aware there were prostitutes staying in my hotel because of the late night noises. There were homeless people near by with shopping carts (they were harmless but it wasnt the nicest thing to have to look at, makes you feel bad if you cant afford to give them food) and on our first night we were off to the local supermarket and we got stopped around 3 times by people asking us for food. We were 18 at the time and kinda terrified. On our first day we also seen two arrests and the local cab driver even asked us why we would choose this area to stay in. One night we were followed to the local Denny's by a car (beware females who dress nicely, in LA people tend to shout out their cars at you alot in the not so nice areas) so we didn't feel safe. Saying that, nowhere seems safe in Hollywood. On about our 3rd day we were talking to this lovely guy on Hollywood Boulevard and all of a sudden this guy comes out of nowhere threatening to shoot him and take his money haha. I do love LA and I wanna go back but next time I am going to stay in the W on hollywood boulevard. There's nice sides of LA and not so nice sides of LA aswell. I knew this before I went but I didn't know exactly where they were, so this is just a heads up. If you can rough it and you are tough enough then by all means stay here. If you like you're like me and you enjoy luxuries and are terrified at night then stay somewhere a little more pricey, it will make your trip alot better. Some of the trips we went on there were amazing, it's a great place but just don't think cause it's Hollywood it's gonna be glam because Hollywood is a pretty big place and it's just not like that. Hollywood Boulevard goes on for miles and some of it is pretty dirty! but the main section of it (hollywood and highland area) is just fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well located Inn”
Reviews.Author: R06R
Reviews.Content: A comfortable 2 star (limited service). I moved here to save 1/3 of the daily rate at the end of a longer trip after staying in a good 4+/5 star hotel in downtown. You pay for the convenience of a subway across the street, and car-parking if you have a car (which I didn't). I wanted to be closer to Hollywood Blvd to do day-trips from there and this Inn allowed me to do that. The front desk was helpful, the large rooms are basic, the 'feel' is safe and friendly, and there is a nice pool area in the centre of a small set of rooms. A good way to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: pgully3
Reviews.Content: Decent room. Nice pool area. Not far from Koreatown or Hollywood. Worth the price (less than $100).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MarieMc85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hollywood City Inn for three nights on the last leg of our two week tour of the West Coast. The hotel is in an okay area. To be honest, I found LA to be dingy and a bit rough in general so don't think that the hotel is in a brilliant or a bad location. The metro station is a 30 second walk from the hotel. Parking was free. The entire check in procedure was conducted whilst the receptionist was on the phone to his friend, which was rude. Although he did carry our suitcases up the stairs (no lift) so I forgave him that! The room was clean and spacious. There was enough storage and a fridge and microwave which was handy. The air con was good. Everytime someone walked around in the room next door, or past our room, the whole room shook. We woke up during this on the first night and thought we were in the middle of an earthquake!! There wasn't enough pillows in the room so we went downstairs and asked the (different this time) receptionist for some more. He started quizzing us about how many pillows we had! He then said he couldn't help us as the housekeeping had gone home. We told him that it wasn't our problem and that we needed another pillow. He said that guests take the pillows home with them which is why there was a shortage!!! He eventually got us another pillow after we went downstairs and asked him again. I also wanted to use the phone and was told that I had to pay a $10 deposit even though they had my card details. He then said that if I called outside the immediate area, they would count that as an international call, ith a $5 minimum charge so I said not to bother!!! The pool area was nice and clean although there were only four sunloungers. Everyday, the owners/cleaners, who have an apartment next to the pool, would use two of the sun loungers to dry their washing on which was annoying. The washing would be on them all day. The breakfast wasn't very good. Cereal and donuts. You are only allowed to use the "free" internet for 15 minutes for the whole duration of your stay! And that is 15 minutes for the whole room, not per person. They also charge 50 cents to print out a page. Overall, the pluses outweighed the minuses and I would stay again and recommend to others. There is a really nice Thai restaurant named "Thai Patio" that is just down the road from the hotel. Turn left and cross the road and it is on your left.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but a good affordable place”
Reviews.Author: snowmonster
Reviews.Content: We were away for three weeks in America so we couldn't afford to splash out on expensive hotels all the time. This place was less than 70 dollars, was roughly in the right part of town for the attractions, although when walking back from the strip after dark we didn't feel entirely comfortable. However, the hotel itself is clean and has a lovely pool area with roses and a good place to sit and eat the basic but free breakfast of donuts, frosted flakes, juice and coffee, great if you just wanted to get out and sightsee without having to worry about finding breakfast first. We stayed two nights and slept well. The room was basic and a bit dingy but had everything you needed, the bathroom could do with modernising. Overall I would stay here again although I would prefer to stretch my budget a bit next time for a fancier place in WeHo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: Aaron737
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location. Walking distance to hollywood/western station we used this line nearly everyday to get around. We stayed 9 nights at the hotel - no problems at all. Thai restaurants near by were great and affordable. The hotels rooms were very simple and bland, but clean and comfortable. The owner/manager was always friendly and helpful. We felt safe, but we were not out late at night. certainly would go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation- superb price-hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: Mavros66
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 days in april....we found from the outset we were treated with care & friendliness...the room was spacious ... quiet ....& very clean... breakfast provided was adequate & coffee great to start the day .....free 10minute internet access was a fantastic extra facility for people on the move...all in all...a welcome haven in hollywood..... we will be back. PACO...GRACIAS POR SU GRAN HOSPITALIDAD

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: eblau
Reviews.Content: We got a room on the second floor down at the end of the breezeway, so we didn't have any people walking by or making noise. The room was rather small and showed some wear and tear, but was very clean and smelled fresh when we first arrived and during our stay (5 nights). With the AC running, we did not hear much noise from the streets outside and slept comfortably. The service was good and the gentleman was friendly at check-in and checkout. However, they could not accommodate our request for an extra pillow for my pregnant wife who really needed an extra one to get comfortable. (There were only 2 pillows per double bed, so we didn't have any extra.) The complimentary breakfast of milk, orange juice, coffee, donuts and frosted flakes was a simple and informal, but nice way to start the day. The pool area is very nice and clean and surrounded by beautiful rose bushes. The free WiFi was nice too, although the connection was rather flaky. If we moved locations in the room, the connection would be lost. The hotel is in a seedier area of Hollywood, as others have mentioned, but we felt safe the entire time we were there. The location is very good and centrally located to many of the sites we wanted to see. With LA traffic, don't underestimate the importance of location!!! All in all, this was a great value and we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraipser
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to LA by myself, so finding a cheap hotel was very important. At $68 a night, I wasn't sure what to expect from this motel, but I was very satisfied. I stayed here for 6 nights, and have mostly positive things to say. The room was clean (although the bathroom was in need of some renovation), the bed was very comfortable, and there were no problems with the tv, heat/AC, fridge or microwave. The motel is only about a two minute walk to the subway. The pool area was lovely and would have been a nice place to have my morning coffee, had the weather cooperated! Everyone at the front desk was very helpful. The free wireless internet was great, as was the computer in the lobby. I wouldn't think twice about staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Questionable Location...”
Reviews.Author: SunnyCoastAussies
Reviews.Content: The motel is in a 'seedier' part of Hollywood, so not the safest place to be out at night (as told to us many times by cab drivers!) but as with most things in LA, its close to everything. The service was fine, the room was comfortable, however as ours was on the corner down a corridoor, it was set out strangeley and the door opened onto the bedside table and you had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom as the chair was in the way. Our friend had the room next to ours and his was set out fine, so there was no complaints. The room smelt fresh (like laundry powder) which was nice. The wireless internet worked sporadically depending on where you stood in the room. For the cost, its a nice place to stay and I would stay here again (I would just request any room other than 115) Beds comfortable, , staff nice... great for the cost

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but hotel is average at best”
Reviews.Author: Hope-Dutchman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a questionable part of Hollywood, a good 2 miles from the Kodak and Grauman's theaters. I wouldn't recommend walking, so the location doesn't turn out to be as good as you would expect. You can pick up the subway or the buses from nearby, but that can be done from other hotels as well. The location does provide for a very easy drive up to the Griffith Observatory. The beds were not good. Felt like we were sleeping on springs. This was definitely the worst part of the stay. The rooms were a little more quiet than I anticipated based on earlier reviews. The breakfast was not much more than frosted flakes and coffee, but I don't think they try to sell it as much more than that. The rooms were clean, and the staff was nice. But the hotel was far from special. Bottom line is the hotel is very basic, and the beds are not good. I was OK with the room from a value perspective, but my wife would have rather stayed at a nicer place and paid the higher prices. It all depends on your personal tradeoff between value and quality.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overrated. Good for bargain hunters.”
Reviews.Author: MattyOSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights to see Paul McCartney at the Hollywood Bowl. Not a bad base of operations, but I wouldn't call it a "nice" place to stay. Acceptable enough, for $68 a night, king bed. The price is hard to beat. We had two rooms. There were no problems with our friend's room, but our "non-smoking" room smelled of smoke and strong cleaner/chemical smell. The rooms seemed pretty clean but after settling in we noticed a big patch of mold behind the bathroom door, between the door frame & tub. Gross! Also several guests had small children who were running around yelling at the crack of dawn, which didn't jibe with our previous late-nite tour of classic Hollywood dive bars... The location is ok, about a mile from Hollywood & Vine, another half mile or so to Grumman's Chinese Theatre. A pretty long walk, but if you like to walk, its kinda cool to tramp up and down the "Walk of Fame". A cab ride each way will cost about $6-9 w/tip. The immediate neighborhood is a bit rough, you are in the east part of Hollywood, in Thai Town/Little Armenia. There was an Armenian (mob-related?) murder in the area the night we stayed there. Not recommended to single women, unless you are street smart. However, the place itself seems safe. You could bring a family here. I wasn't too concerned to leave my laptop in the room. Free WiFi was a plus, too. And, some good low-budget restaurants in the area- Thai, Mexican. This place was described as "charmingly seedy" on Yelp, and that's not far off the mark. They make an effort to keep the place nice. it's not bad, but if you're used to the Hilton or Marriott, you won't be happy here. Not sure how they got such a high rating on Tripadvisor. I wouldn't object to staying here again, but I'd check into other options first - someplace a bit closer to the main part of hollywood, or maybe just a little nicer. TIPS- go up to Grifith Obsevatory. An icon! It's close by, awesome veiw of the city, Hollywood sign, etc. And all free, except for the main planetarium theater, which we skipped, but is supposed to be well worth it. Check out the Frolic Room, one of Hollywood's most classic dives. And great happy hour food and drinks at The Well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Good location”
Reviews.Author: worldclassinspector
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights during the Oscars and it was really affordable, yet clean and nice. But it's necessary to have aq car in LA. The breakfast was doughnuts and coffee, but for the price per night, you cannot expect much more. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for the price”
Reviews.Author: grischnackh
Reviews.Content: As many have previously said, this hotel is probably highly rated as a result of the price. I think we had 5 nights stay for 3 people coming in at about $383, which was way cheaper than a lot of other places I looked into. The rooms aren't great - don't expect luxury soaps for a start. Bathroom and main room are a little dingy and dusty, so if you're expecting super clean don't come here. Windows don't open so if you're caustrophobic and like to sleep with a window open at night, forget it. The blinds are also a litte gappy so light does come in at night. Room is a bit dark and gloomy due to poor lighting lamps. Fridge is noisy and had to be turned off at night. Other than these disadvantages, unless I found a better deal for the price I would stay here again. The staff aren't overly friendly although the older dude did make a bit of an effort. The free donuts, coffee, cereal and juice for breakfast is awesome. It's very informal but it's nice to come down in the morning for a quick start up before leaving for the day. Free computer/internet use is also cool. The location is great - if you're the person who enjoys walking everywhere, think otherwise because it's about 30mins away to the Kodak Theatre, but the good thing is that the subway is about 2 mins walk away from the hotel. Transport is super cheap in LA so it was so easy just to hop on a train and go into town. There is also a nice shopping complex across the road with a Ross bargain store and a supermarket, which is always a plus for us as I like a break from takeaway once in a while while travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmajh
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was handy for shops, metro station, Hollywood and a fantastic local Mexican restaurant. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool area was welcoming too. I would stay here again, given half the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Brentivo
Reviews.Content: LA is a really massive place with poor public transport, so location is hard to comment on, but we really loved this place. It is around the corner from hollywood bvd. It was cheap and clean, it included breakfast (donuts) and it had recently been renovated (always good). The staff were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place. Try the Mexican restaurant across the street!

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: Aaxell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay if you stay for a couple of days. The parking is free, which is good. Wifi is free, which is good (you have to get a password at the lobby). But it was very noisy. You can hear everyone in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and spotless”
Reviews.Author: travellingscouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights, room spotless and cleaned every day. Fresh towels, nice big TV. Wi-Fi worked fine and there is a pc in the reception to pick up email. Bed was nice and firm, great nights sleep. Plenty of off road parking. Only 5 mins from Hollywood Walk Of Fame. We did not venture out on foot in the area but had no problems driving to local shops at all hours. Has pool and laundry.

Reviews.Title: “:)”
Reviews.Author: Pretzelangel
Reviews.Content: May look like a budget motel but it has everything a traveller wants. Nice, clean bed - spacious room. Continental breakkie was nice. It has hot water which was what I needed. Free internet and parking. There is one washing machine and dryer downstairs by the pool entrance. Good value motel in Hollywood. VERY convenient location, only 5 mins walk to MetroRail which takes you to most of the attractions ($5 for a daypass). And Starbucks is just across from Metro. Less than 10 mins walk to Food 4 Less supermarket and MacDs. It's fine to walk in daylight but it can bit scary to walk at night (there are people lurking by everywhere. Must give credit to the Reception - Tahir and Paco are very friendly and they'll help you with directions and infor. They even gave us washing powder when we didn't have any. Tip - Ask for the room upstairs, they are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Best cost benefit”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdddictedd
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location with a 24hs walgreens in front, the rooms that i stayed for 7 days was very clean and cozy, it has lcd tv, a nice heater, free wi-fi, free parking, free breakfast and for a great price. The recepcionists are very atencious, helpfull and polite. I me and my family recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: Raffasworld
Reviews.Content: Pros: in L.A. it's impossible to find this price for a hotel. it's really bargain and you are in Hollywood. location is awesome, even if you need a car to go around looking for bars and restaurants. great pool and garden and... free parking (impossible to find in L.A.). if your budget it's not the best, this hotel is the best! cons: breakfast is just very poor...better to go somewhere in the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain in LA”
Reviews.Author: sgtmorrison
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of this place yesterday and wanted to confirm a lot of the positive reviews on this place. First, the location is good. Half block from the Hollywood/Western Metro. Two stops will get you to Hollywood/Highland where the Chinese Theatre and Walk of Fame is. Free parking. Although limited at times, this serves perfect for when you want to drive around or go up to the Hollywood Sign or down to Pink's Hot Dogs, come back and have a space there for your rental car without any worry. We were in and out at all hours and always had a few spaces to choose from. The room is pretty big. Much bigger than the other place we stayed at during this trip. With fridge. microwave, desk, chair and of course TV. They have a nice sized pool, although we didn't use it. Tthe breakfast of Donuts, Cereal and coffee is free. The front desk guys were all polite and helpful answering our questions. I could believe how quiet is was during the morning hours. I will stay here when I return to LA. For the price and location, this can't be beat in the LA/Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JPF_MAW
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the Hollywood area then this is probably one of the best value hotels there in terms of cost. Didn't spend much time around the hotel, but from what we experienced the staff were friendly and helpful and the swimming pool looked quite nice. Our room was clean and big, no frills but no complaints. About a half an hour walk to the main strip, i.e. walk of fame etc. Free parking was a definite plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alliyance
Reviews.Content: Spend 4 nights at the Hollywood city inn. For the price, I think it's the best motel you can have. It's clean and the rooms are big. I did 5 different hotels and this is the best one by far for the price. The free parking is a big plus and you get also a continental breakfast. Donuts, Croissant and cereal. Cafe and tea are included. If you chose to stay there, ask to be located on the second floor, much more peaceful. Rent a car will be best cause it's not near to Beverly hills or downtown Hollywood (30 min of walking distance to Chinese theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBoatingMan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We stayed for 5 nights in October 2009. For the price we were not expecting much but we were pleasantly suprised. Rooms are nice and clean, and they are serviced daily. We arrived early (8AM) and they serviced our room straight away to get us in. The breakfast is basic but still ok. You get coffee, orange juice, a few cereals and croissants. The owners were friendly and provided us with all the directions and information we needed. The subway is really close as well as shopping centres and fast food restaurants. The room had a fridge for us to use which was great, but no microwave. For the price this place was great. Most the other hotels in Hollywood cost around $200, so this place is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Below average but afforable”
Reviews.Author: TarragindiTripper
Reviews.Content: First of all, our room smelled bad - the stench of an acrid cleaning agent working hard to mask something more sinister. The smell was almost overpowering when you'd enter the room, but you got used it it. Sort of. You couldn't open the windows more than a crack to get fresh air circulating, so that didn't help. The room was dark and dingy but clean where it mattered most - the bed - which is why we went ahead and stayed there for the two nights we'd booked. The bathroom was not up to my standards of cleanliness. Bath, basin and toilet were clean enough, it's just that there were weird stains on the mirror, the walls, the back of the door...you get the picture. Dire need of a makeover, this place. Location was quite good, within walking distance of many Thai restaurants and other cheap eateries. Felt safe enough to walk around at night. Our room was at the back, off street, so we didn't get street noise, but one night reception (or so they claimed to be) rang at 11pm, waking us to persistently ask for someone called Henry Somethingorother in room 403, who most definitely wasn't staying in our room (which was indeed 403). Our room was also close to the back entry door, so that was kind of noisy with people coming and going, but not so noisy that it woke you at night. I was a bit concerned about security though, since you don't need a swipe card or anything to get in the building (except reception - separate building), so in theory anyone off the street can gain access and loiter in the halls or stairwells. But we didn't see anything like that during our stay. The free parking was good - one of the reasons we chose the place, as well as the surprisingly sunny reviews it gets on Trip Advisor - and it's close to a busy bus stop for those travelling without a car. Finally, the staff. The guy who checked us in was friendly and professional, but the woman we had to deal with to get the login details for the free WIFI was downright rude. Oh, and the continental breakfast is pretty much nonexistent. This place was okay for us for two nights at the end of our holiday, but if I find myself in Hollywood again I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...clean and basic”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. Not much of historical significance around the hotel but the subway at the corner of the block takes you right down to all the fun Hollywood stuff in 5 minutes. Hotel is very basic but clean. There is some wear but not enough to be concern. I was on the main floor and could hear people walking around upstairs so if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the higher floor. Paco at the front desk is very helpful with directions and for generating ideas on what to do. Breakfast is basic (toast, cereal, coffee, juice and doughnuts) and much appreciated. Tip: Went across the street to the Rincon ??? Restaurant. Absolutely fantastic Mexican food and not that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights at the start of a two week holiday and were very pleased with what we found.The rooms are spacious and clean as was the bathroom.The beds are comfortable and everything worked fine.The only thing missing was a kettle to make your own coffee etc but that's not the end of the world.The guy that checked us in didn't say much but the the guy on the desk the following day was friendly and helpful with directions.For a decent meal check out the 101 Cafe on Franklin Ave,about a 5/10 min drive from the Inn,Ashley Jensen fron Ugly Betty was in there with her partner!All in all i would recommend the Inn for anyone looking for a clean and great value for money place to stay,i would use it again on my next trip to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: lusanne79
Reviews.Content: We spend our first two days in this hotel. No palace but clean, friendly and good location. Free wireless internet was good and free parking!! Some notes: the airco did make noises and breakfast exciists only donuts, other sweet bread and little croissants. Overall it was really a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly? Not That Bad.”
Reviews.Author: PuffC
Reviews.Content: Not a bad motel-style place. The rooms are pretty well used, and have definitely not been updated for a while. Our room was clean, and as well presented as possible. Has a nice little pool surrounded by rose bushes. Biggest downsides: the thin walls and the noise from other guests... While we were there, the hotel seemed to attract a party crowd, who were very loud at night. Next time I would rather save for a little longer, and stay somewhere nicer, but for West Hollywood on a budget, it was pretty decent. The free high speed internet was pretty decent, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: TravelVitamin
Reviews.Content: The owner and receptionist are friendly. There was one day the pastries(strange for breakfast though caused there is no bread provided) were all gone, the owner immediately drove to somewhere nearby to replenish. Good service. The room is big though but the toilet is old and the door couldn't close good. Airco so it's good for the always warm weather in L.A. No breakfast area so people has to bring the breakfast in their room or sit by the tables at the swimming pool. Overall good value for a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - a great compromise in LA.”
Reviews.Author: Ourarka
Reviews.Content: LA can be very expensive, and very hard to find a good place. The Hollywood City Inn is a good choice if you want to combine value with location. It is a little rough round the edges, but perfectly clean and comfortable with a great pool area and a very helpful and friendly proprietor. Breakfast is simple ... but free! It is in the eastern section of West Hollywood, so unless you have good knowledge of the LA transport system you will need a car to get around. The nearest attraction is Hollywood Boulevard, which is probably just a little to far to be a walk away. That said, with a car nothing is more than 20-30 minutes drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in LA? Probably!”
Reviews.Author: komytee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel/motel for 8 nights and I was really pleased with my stay. The hotel is conveniently located near Hollywood Blvd. There is a metro station (red line from North Hollywood to Union Station) just 3 minutes away. There are all kinds of bus stops on Hollywood Blvd, Western Ave and Sunset Blvd within walking distance (2 / 5 mins). The room was clean, but looked a bit dated. They were actually in the process of changing the window curtains to shutters, so they are definitely working on that. The room had everything I needed: a big comfortable bed, shower / bath, a small fridge, microwave and a TV with a lot of channels. Room was cleaned every day. I have seen 2 different guys at the front desk. The older one usually was there during breakfast and was a very nice guy. Speaking about the breakfast: croissants, donuts, cerea, milk, coffeel and orange juice were available at no extra charge. The other one didn't say a lot, but he checked me in the best room out there (2nd floor in the middle with view on pool), so no complains. There is a computer available in the "lobby". Free to use for 15 minutes at a time. There is a note saying that they charge you for 50 cent per page printed, but the older guy never charged me for anything. As said, there is a pool available which seems to be clean. I have never used it though. The neighborhood is not the prettiest, but I have never felt unsafe. There's always activity on Hollywood Blvd so I would imaging there is always someone to help you out if needed. There are a couple of small markets across the street for your fresh fruits or other daily needs. On Sunset Blvd (5 minutes walk) there are 2 large pharmacies, a big supermarket (Food for Less) and a McDonalds. On Hollywood Blvd there's a Starbucks, Quiznos Sub and a bank with ATM machine. This was one of the cheapest hotels I could find in LA, so no surprise I was very pleased overall. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone travelling to LA and looking for save some bucks for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bazzeman
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with good service and clean rooms! Great location near Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: klocco1
Reviews.Content: We arrive at the hotel extremely late 12:30 am (3:30am east coast time) and we were very tired. The owner of the hotel was in the lobby when we arrived, checked us in and gave us the key to room 307, no hassles! Room 307 was in the adjacent building next to the lobby, and I did think it a bit weird when we were pulling our luggage through that building when we saw people sleeping in the downstairs rooms with the doors open. I believe this hotel also had people living there full time. Room 307 was clean and comfortable, but there was a huge light outside of the room and our room was illuminated all night long. I asked to be switched the next day and we were given room 205 at the top of the stairs overlooking the little pool. Room 205 was huge and had a big vanity (something everyone needs traveling with 2 teenage girls). Hotel was a little Diamond in the Rough. Nice hotel, but the surrounding area was a gritty, working class LA neighborhood. I never felt unsafe, but I do not think I would walk around at night by myself. The hotel owner was always helpful and I enjoyed talking to him. What I liked: 1. Hotel was clean and safe, big rooms for not that much money. 2. Continental Breakfast each morning 3. Computer for hotel guests. 4. Subway 1 block to the left so you can go to the Hollywood walk of fame and gawk. 5. Wahlgreens and CVS 1 block to the right if you need any personal items. 6. Parking is FREE! 7. Pool if you want to relax. All in all, my experience at this little hotel was fine and for the money, you can not beat it. Hotel owner was trying very hard to make it a comfortable place. Little things around the hotel need to be fixed, but they are trying. I wish this little hotel the best!

Reviews.Title: “A good location”
Reviews.Author: holiday021
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is in a good location to see all of the tourist attractions of Hollywood. Only a 20 minute walk to the Hollywood Walk of Fame, the Kodak Theatre and the Grauman's Chinese Theatre. Universal Studios is only a 15 minute drive away. The staff very pleasant and helpful. Altough the rates are very reasonable the rooms are very tired looking and in need of redecoration our room smelt of cigarette smoke , the bedding had cigarette burns in it. and the fridge was balanced with an ash tray underneath it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Gav1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights, and it was great accomadation at a cheap price. Location was good - approx 30min walk to the Walk Of Fame, Hoolywood sign easily seen also. Room was big and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Little_Lebowski
Reviews.Content: We were only spending a couple of nights in LA and wanted somewhere in a good location to make the most of the time we had. We were also working to a budget, and this was the only hotel we could find in the area within our price range that didn't sound too horrific. I wasn't entirely sure what to expect, and the front desk didn't inspire much confidence. It was rather bleak, and it seemed that we were an inconvenience to the lady at reception. Once we checked in, we made our way to the room, prepared for the worse. We needn't have worried. The room was large and clean, with plenty of storage area and a decent bathroom (although the toilet seemed to have a mind of its own when it comes to flushing!). We made use of the pool area once or twice, which was quite pleasant. The area felt safe enough, and was right next to the subway which made getting around a piece of cake. We got a code to use the internet, which wasn't all that speedy, but sufficient for e-mailing. Breakfast was included, if rather limited, but I didn't expect much more for the money. All-in-all, the grumpy staff aside, I'd definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Hollywood working to a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and decent hotel for the money. Would book again”
Reviews.Author: OSXXYYY
Reviews.Content: For the money that I paid, I cant complain about this hotel. I had free WiFi, the pool was cool. Breakfast was a non-event but I knew that before I booked and I didn't want sugary - fatty donuts or pastries so I got my own from outside. If you like fatty things then you'll be OK. There's a Mexican across the road to the right that opens at 8 every day and that's very reasonable for a hot breakfast that was relatively healthy. I liked the flatscreen TV that I turned into a 32" computer monitor for my mac laptop. Nice. Location-wise there's free parking and you're only about 15 -20 minutes drive from most places and a few minutes drive from many of the freeways/motorways. I'd stay here again on my next visit as there's nothing negative to report other than two small insects in the room and the toilet filler making a little too much noise but that could happen anywhere and remember this is a two star establishment. It's in a neighborhood which seems safe which is really important. My room and bathroom was huge.

Reviews.Title: “For price, it is a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beau_and_Monique
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in many hotels but the price you pay for the Hollywood City Inn, it is perfect given location. I am not sure why you would want to pay mega $$$ for a hotel unless you plan to stay in it most of the time. We found our room to be a nice size, clean and the maids cleaned every day. The guy at the help desk was very helpful and friendly, he helped us with buses etc. Free internet at the help desk. Continental breakfast - danish's, very sugary cereals, tea / coffee etc. We did not use the pool but it looked clean. You can either bus or walk to the main attractions (i.e chinese theatre) however we chose to walk - would probably be 6ish blocks or a 15 minute walk. All the restaurants are in this area and we caught a cab 1 night and it cost about $15. If you like modern Japanese food, I would highly recommend the Geisha House. We also caught a cab to the Viper Room and Rainbow Bar and it cost about $20 one way. I caught a bus to the Getty one day which is relatively easy to do (2 connections - 40 minutes) and my wife caught a bus to the Market. My wife did the dearly departed tour and highly recommends it. The area is fine although it is a big city and like ALL big cities, I would not recommend walking too far at night time if you dont know the area, we found it fine although can't say we walked too much at night time because we were tired from day time activities. As other writers have said, it is right on the cusp of Thai Town and the curries there are top quality (also, places like Burger King are in the area too). There is an authentic mexican restaurant across the road which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good sized rooms, Good price, helpful front desk.”
Reviews.Author: Lofty42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of April and again in May 2009 no problems at all. metro close on corner of hollywood blvd 3$ and 3 stops to chinese theater, supermarket on the corner. Rooms ok microwave ,fridge, flat screen tv,The man on the day shift front desk was very helpful. If you want to eat close by there are a number of places close by on Sunset Blvd turn right out of hotel and second right onto the Blvd Dennys about 400 mtres along on the right. All in all an OK place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value you will find in Hollywood!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NinaBelena
Reviews.Content: Not sure why some folks have issues with this place? It's in a normal neighborhood (it's LA folks.), close to freeways, Hollywood Blvd, ralph's/walgreens/Food 4 Less (buy your alcohol here), and a ton of crazy nightclubs and Thai restaurants. There's free parking, free wifi in your room, and a swimming pool. We were greeted with a clean, simple room. The bathroom looked newly renovated, tiles and everything. Be prepared to walk 300 ft to Walgreen's if you forgot your soap, they are lacking that here; the store is open 24 hours in case you arrive in the middle of the night and want to smell good. The room also comes with a mediocre tv, microwave, and fridge (store alcohol here). A the best value if you don't mind listening to Frenchies sunbathe and smoke cigs all day :)

Reviews.Title: “Location and price hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: setravelWPB
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable rooms. No problems with cleanliness. Very convenient location, especially if you like Thai food as it's right on the edge of Thai town. As for the neighborhood it's not Beverly Hills, but we felt perfectly safe to walk around day or evening. Not really sure why some people have felt uncomfortable, it's not at all a dodgy area. Breakfast is basic, but all we wanted was coffee, anyway. An in-room coffee maker would be nice but it's hardly a make or break thing. One thing to point out, I had left an expensive pair of prescription glasses behind. Initially they wanted me to arrange to have FedEx or somebody like that pick them up, but after I explained the difficulty of that they agreed to send them to me where we were staying in NoCal. They could have just easily denied having ever seen the glasses. Much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this motel for 5 nights. The location was good. However rooms were not so well cleaned and there was some problem with air conditioner. The air was not good/fresh in the room, once the conditioner would be turned on. The stuff was not very helpful. And we never received answers to our emails, that we sent later with some questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location, room cleaning service not so great”
Reviews.Author: krysss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood City Inn for one week during April 2009, and found it very good location wise, the Metro Train line station and bus stops are within a couple of minutes walk. Room was quite spacious, the staff at reception is extremely available and helpful. What could be better is the cleaning service in the rooms, the cleaning ladies clearly only wiped the wc, the tub and the sink, made the bed, sprayed some deodorant, but that's all, maybe they swiped the bathroom floor (I say maybe since there was a small piece of toilet paper behind the wc on the first day, and it was still there when we left, we just left it there as a test). The carpet was absolutely NEVER cleaned once during our stay and must say it was quite dirty, my husband dared walking in the room for one night with thick white socks he used instead of slippers, and after one night only, they were completely black on the soles........
